2019-05-12T15:10:41Z:
And that's a wrap on Autosport's Live coverage of the Spanish Grand Prix, won comfortably by new points leader Lewis Hamilton.
 
See you again in two weeks' time for the Monaco Grand Prix, but stick with Autosport in the coming days for news and analysis, videos and podcasts following the race in Barcelona.
 
Spanish Grand Prix: Hamilton defeats Bottas in another Mercedes 1-2Lewis Hamilton moved into the Formula 1 points lead after beating team-mate Valtteri Bottas to win the Spanish Grand Prix, as Mercedes continued its perfect start to the season
2019-05-12T15:02:15Z: Hamilton stands on top of the podium. Flags, national anthems, champagne – you know the drill.
2019-05-12T14:55:09Z: Hamilton embraces his team in parc ferme, having now gone top of the points. Bottas gets a quick handshake.
2019-05-12T14:50:31Z: Outside the points: 11 Albon; 12 Ricciardo; 13 Hulkenberg; 14 Raikkonen; 15 Perez; 16 Giovinazzi; 17 Russell; 18 Kubica
2019-05-12T14:50:05Z: Result: 1 Hamilton; 2 Bottas; 3 Verstappen; 4 Vettel; 5 Leclerc; 6 Gasly; 7 Magnussen; 8 Sainz; 9 Kvyat; 10 Grosjean
2019-05-12T14:49:40Z: Verstappen stays clear of Vettel to complete the podium, followed by Leclerc and Gasly.
2019-05-12T14:49:25Z: Hamilton crosses the line and wins the Spanish GP by 4.074s over Bottas in yet another Mercedes one-two!
2019-05-12T14:48:33Z: Magnussen pumps in his personal best lap of the race to cement seventh place.
2019-05-12T14:48:02Z: Hamilton is onto his last lap, 3.7s clear of Bottas.
2019-05-12T14:47:48Z: Vettel does his best lap of the day so far, but it's only a tenth quicker than Verstappen so they stay 1.7s apart in third and fourth.
2019-05-12T14:47:14Z: Albon is still unable to find a way past Grosjean as we approach the final lap of the race.
2019-05-12T14:45:11Z: Four laps left, Hamilton's lead stands at 2.9s, with Verstappen another 3.5s back. Vettel has drifted 2s away from Verstappen now so that one has also fizzled out.
2019-05-12T14:43:32Z: How quickly things can change. Grosjean looked well set to finish best of the rest before the safety car, but is just about clinging on to the points now! Kvyat has also made his way ahead of the Haas man.
2019-05-12T14:40:53Z: Sainz gets by next time round though by breezing past the Haas on the run to the first corner with the help of DRS. Eighth place for the McLaren now.
2019-05-12T14:40:47Z: Is there a chance of late excitement in the podium battle? Vettel is still only 1.5s behind Verstappen and not being dropped.
2019-05-12T14:39:53Z: Grosjean ends up on the Turn 1 runoff again, this time after banging wheels with Sainz. The McLaren went down the inside, the Haas stayed to the outside, they touched briefly and the Haas stayed ahead by scooting off track.
2019-05-12T14:38:47Z: Lead gaps with nine laps left: 1 Hamilton; 2 Bottas +2.3s; 3 Verstappen +5.1s; 4 Vettel +6.8s; 5 Leclerc +9.1s; 6 Gasly +12.1s
2019-05-12T14:37:03Z: Ricciardo asks Renault to be released from behind Hulkenberg as he feels he is losing too much time, and is immediately granted that wish. He's now half a second behind 11th-place man Albon.
2019-05-12T14:36:34Z: Stroll's unsalvageable Racing Point is lifted away
2019-05-12T14:35:32Z: Verstappen inches a little further clear of Vettel to make third look more comfortable.
2019-05-12T14:34:54Z: Bottas is replying, he goes 2.2s quicker than Hamilton on that lap and brings the gap down to 2.7s again. Is that a coordinated Mercedes attempt for them both to have a crack at fastest lap point?
2019-05-12T14:33:55Z: Vettel is lurking within DRS range of Verstappen's third place now. Leclerc has fallen 2.2s off their tail but shaken off Gasly.
2019-05-12T14:33:35Z: Stewards say the incident between Norris and Stroll will be investigated after the race.
2019-05-12T14:33:33Z: Hamilton is nearly 5s ahead of Bottas again after just two laps of racing.
2019-05-12T14:33:21Z: And Hamilton follows that new fastest lap up with another one that's 1.4s quicker still - a 1m18.492s.
2019-05-12T14:33:07Z: Sainz has passed Kvyat for ninth, to give those home fans something to cheer about.
2019-05-12T14:32:54Z: Hamilton makes his intentions pretty clear with a new fastest lap of 1m19.850s, which was 1.4s faster than Bottas on the restart lap.
2019-05-12T14:32:45Z: Magnussen is seventh courtesy of a moment for team-mate Grosjean on the restart.
2019-05-12T14:32:19Z: As Gasly runs wide following his attack on Leclerc, he almost loses out to Magnussen but holds on around the outside at Turn 4 to keep sixth.
2019-05-12T14:31:22Z: Hamilton jumps through the final corners and maintains his lead over Bottas, with Verstappen and Vettel holding third and fourth while Gasly takes a big look at Leclerc for fifth.
2019-05-12T14:27:14Z: Lapped cars are now being allowed to move around to the back of the train - which is good news for Bottas as he had a stack of traffic between himself and Hamilton in the queue initially.
2019-05-12T14:21:24Z: Out of the race: Stroll, Norris
2019-05-12T14:21:17Z: Outside the points: 11 Albon; 12 Hulkenberg; 13 Ricciardo; 14 Perez; 15 Raikkonen; 16 Giovinazzi; 17 Russell; 18 Kubica
2019-05-12T14:20:53Z: Order under safety car: 1 Hamilton; 2 Bottas; 3 Verstappen; 4 Vettel; 5 Leclerc; 6 Gasly; 7 Grosjean; 8 Magnussen; 9 Kvyat; 10 Sainz
2019-05-12T14:20:20Z: Grosjean also pitted, and both Haas cars are now on softs. Kvyat has mediums, while Sainz stayed out for an extra lap but has now pitted and rejoined in 10th on softs.
2019-05-12T14:19:36Z: As a result of those quick-fire stops, Magnussen has managed to jump back ahead of Kvyat for eighth.
2019-05-12T14:19:04Z: Gasly went back to softs in his pitstop. The Mercedes are on softs too, then the Verstappen/Ferraris third to fifth group is all mediums.
2019-05-12T14:18:38Z: Leclerc fell behind Verstappen and Vettel by pitting, but he was almost certainly going to on track anyway.
2019-05-12T14:18:23Z: Gasly also gets a stop done.
2019-05-12T14:17:59Z: Kvyat, Magnussen and Albon all dive for the pits in the midfield order too.
2019-05-12T14:17:55Z: Hamilton takes softs at that stop and rejoins still in the lead. Leclerc pits too.
2019-05-12T14:17:31Z: The safety car is called as Norris and Stroll collide! Hamilton dives straight into the pits.
2019-05-12T14:16:22Z: Bottas takes softs and rejoins still a second clear of Leclerc in second place. Expect Hamilton to copy that move any time soon too.
2019-05-12T14:15:29Z: Verstappen and Vettel are catching Leclerc for third extremely quickly, over a second per lap quicker.
2019-05-12T14:14:49Z: Bottas now nearly has enough of a margin to pit and get out ahead of Leclerc still. And even if he doesn't, you'd assume a Mercedes on new softs or mediums would pass a Ferrari on old hards fairly easily.
2019-05-12T14:13:50Z: Verstappen gets out a comfortable 6s ahead of Vettel and 6s behind Leclerc - who he now needs to hunt down and pass on track.
2019-05-12T14:13:05Z: Verstappen dives in for the stop he needs.
2019-05-12T14:12:50Z: Up front, the Mercedes are basically matching each other, 8.5s apart.
2019-05-12T14:12:37Z: Vettel bangs in a new fastest lap of 1m20.065s, which is 2s quicker than Leclerc managed on his hards on the last lap.
2019-05-12T14:12:10Z: No change in the midfield order. Grosjean now has 8.5s in hand at the head of the pack in seventh, ahead of Kvyat, Magnussen and Albon.
2019-05-12T14:12:08Z: Gaps on lap 42: 1 Hamilton; 2 Bottas +7.6s; 3 Verstappen +13.0s; 4 Leclerc +28.8s; 5 Vettel +42.8s; 6 Gasly +46.5s
2019-05-12T14:11:32Z: That was a pretty neat move down the inside into the tight Turn 10 at the end of the back straight as Vettel took fifth from Gasly.
2019-05-12T14:10:44Z: Vettel quickly sweeps past Gasly and starts charging. He's got a 16s gap to catch Leclerc back up and take fourth now - and needs to pull off a bit of an undercut miracle to have a shot at Verstappen's third place.
2019-05-12T14:09:50Z: Vettel takes fresh mediums and comes back out right behind Gasly.
2019-05-12T14:09:35Z: Vettel makes the first move and pits.
2019-05-12T14:07:57Z: If Hamilton does have to come in again, he's going to be far enough ahead of the not-stopping-surely Leclerc to stay in front. Then it's a matter of whether Bottas or Vettel fancies stretching their tyres to the finish and staying out.
2019-05-12T14:06:40Z: Gasly does his best lap of the race so far, which firmly cements the lonely sixth place in which he seems to be living this season.
2019-05-12T14:05:59Z: Hulkenberg has finally pitted and rejoins in 16th on softs. Can he do a similarly impressive stint on that tyre?
2019-05-12T14:05:29Z: Verstappen absolutely has to pit again because he's only used softs so far, and he has to go to mediums or hards (and only mediums would be worthwhile) when he stops. Vettel's not catching him yet, but the 11s gap between the Red Bull and Ferrari isn't anywhere near enough for a pitstop.
2019-05-12T14:05:19Z: A rare, but significant, change in the midfield. Kvyat has got past Magnussen for eighth.
2019-05-12T14:04:15Z: The gap between the two Mercedes has inched back up to 9s in Hamilton's favour now.
2019-05-12T14:03:57Z: Vettel is now 11.7s behind Verstappen ahead in third.
2019-05-12T14:03:39Z: Now the Ferraris swap places again - Leclerc backs off out of Turn 4 and Vettel goes through.
2019-05-12T14:03:21Z: Bottas seems to be mulling strategy options, with his engineer discussing where he'd end up if he pitted again and who he'd have to overtake.
2019-05-12T14:02:54Z: Looking at what Hulkenberg's doing on mediums further back, Vettel actually ought to be able to get to the end on his set, so it's potentially a straightforward battle for track position between Leclerc and Vettel.
2019-05-12T14:01:32Z: Reminder of the midfield order: 7 Grosjean; 8 Magnussen; 9 Kvyat; 10 Hulkenberg; 11 Albon; 12 Sainz; 13 Ricciardo; 14 Perez; 15 Stroll.
2019-05-12T14:00:40Z: Lead gaps at lap 34: 1 Hamilton; 2 Bottas +8.1s; 3 Verstappen +12.5s; 4 Leclerc +23.5s; 5 Vettel + 24.3s; 6 Gasly +40.1s.
2019-05-12T14:00:38Z: Hulkenberg was holding station nicely in eighth, but has now been passed by Magnussen and Kvyat. Albon's not too far behind the Renault either now.
2019-05-12T14:00:08Z: Verstappen's pace on this second set of softs hasn't been superb - he's actually been dropping a few tenths to the Ferraris each lap, so if he is going to have to stop again it wasn't looking good. But on the last lap, as the Ferraris battled, he added 0.7s to his cushion, putting him 11s ahead.
2019-05-12T13:59:48Z: Kubica comes in to pit for the first time from last, and takes on a set of softs. No prizes for guessing where he rejoins.
2019-05-12T13:58:56Z: Vettel is now trying very hard to get past Leclerc for fourth.
2019-05-12T13:55:39Z: Now it's Vettel's turn to be tight up behind the sister Ferrari and lapping faster. Leclerc is on hards so trying to go to the end, whereas Vettel may well be stopping again. Another switch coming up?
2019-05-12T13:55:00Z: Raikkonen has now pitted after a 28-lap stint, and is back out in 17th - ahead only of Alfa team-mate Giovinazzi and the Williamses.
2019-05-12T13:54:47Z: That lap also brought Bottas's advantage over Verstappen - which was looking slender - up to 4.5s.
2019-05-12T13:54:33Z: Bottas is back in business now he's got fresh mediums - he bangs in a new fastest lap of 1m20.857s and immediately takes 1.3s out of Hamilton's advantage. The gap is down to 8.3s.
2019-05-12T13:52:41Z: Lead order, gaps and tyres after the first stops: 1 Hamilton (M); 2 Bottas +10.1s (M); 3 Verstappen +12.9s (S); 4 Leclerc +23.2s (H); 5 Vettel +24.9s (M); 6 Gasly +35.0s (M)
2019-05-12T13:52:33Z: Grosjean has quickly passed Hulkenberg to reclaim his place at 'Class B' leader in seventh. He got that move done at the end of the back straight.
2019-05-12T13:51:29Z: Grosjean is back out in eighth on mediums. It's just pitlane starter Hulkenberg who's yet to stop at the head of that midfield order.
2019-05-12T13:51:22Z: Hamilton makes his stop now, it's relatively smooth and he rejoins on mediums with a 10.4s. lead.
2019-05-12T13:51:04Z: Correction, Leclerc went onto hard tyres rather than mediums. In theory, that could take him to the end - something the medium users might struggle to and the soft runners really shouldn't be able to.
2019-05-12T13:50:00Z: Both Ferraris are now tight behind the yet to stop Haas of Grosjean, up to fourth place. But Grosjean quickly pits and gets out of their way.
2019-05-12T13:49:42Z: Albon has also pitted and is back out in 13th behind Raikkonen, who a moment ago was passed around the outside out of Turn 4 by Kvyat.
2019-05-12T13:49:36Z: Bottas pits from second place. He also goes for mediums.
2019-05-12T13:49:19Z: Leclerc's stop isn't superb either - 4.4s. He takes mediums and rejoins just ahead of Vettel.
2019-05-12T13:48:56Z: Ricciardo has hards on, while Sainz has the medium.
2019-05-12T13:48:39Z: Replays show Ricciardo finally drafting past Sainz the lap after the McLaren had challenged Gasly. Both have now pitted, as has Perez.
2019-05-12T13:47:57Z: Fastest lap of the race for Vettel on his mediums - it's a 1m21.333s.
2019-05-12T13:47:32Z: Sainz had a bit of a look at Gasly as the Red Bull rejoined from the pits, but now appears to have dropped behind the Renault of Ricciardo.
2019-05-12T13:46:55Z: Though Bottas seems in trouble relative to Hamilton at the end of this stint, consistently losing a second per lap, he's not being caught by Leclerc in third - such is Mercedes' advantage.
2019-05-12T13:46:31Z: The Haas driver rejoins in 14th on mediums, two places clear of Kvyat.
2019-05-12T13:46:08Z: Magnussen pits from sixth, just as he was being caught by Vettel.
2019-05-12T13:45:44Z: Hamilton's lead increases to 8.3s on lap 23. Mercedes, and Leclerc behind, still staying out on the initial tyres.
2019-05-12T13:45:19Z: Unlike Verstappen, Gasly takes mediums. He rejoins in the ninth place spot between Albon and Sainz that Vettel had briefly occupied.
2019-05-12T13:44:07Z: Gasly comes in from fourth place on lap 22.
2019-05-12T13:43:47Z: Kvyat is back out on a set of the mediums, and rejoins in 17th.
2019-05-12T13:43:29Z: Vettel gains eighth as Kvyat bails for the pits in the leading Toro Rosso.
2019-05-12T13:42:41Z: Bottas lost a full second to Hamilton on the last lap and is now 7.6s behind.
2019-05-12T13:42:24Z: Vettel has quickly disposed of Albon and is up to ninth, and now trails Kvyat by just half a second.
2019-05-12T13:42:05Z: Much smoother for Verstappen and Red Bull - he rejoins on more softs rather than going to mediums and rejoins fifth ahead of Grosjean.
2019-05-12T13:41:42Z: Hamilton bangs in another new fastest lap - 1m21.527s - and his lead grows to a massive 6.9s as Bottas seems to be losing pace at the end of this stint.
2019-05-12T13:41:20Z: Verstappen pits too next time around.
2019-05-12T13:41:08Z: That's a bad stop for Vettel too, a detail at the rear costs him a couple of seconds and he rejoins between Albon and Sainz in 10th, having taken mediums.
2019-05-12T13:40:16Z: Vettel makes the pitstop he's been so keen for.
2019-05-12T13:39:56Z: After gaining a bit in traffic initially, Bottas loses out again and the gap shoots up to 5.3s.
2019-05-12T13:38:57Z: Bottas is chipping a little bit back from Hamilton as they lap Williams. The gap is 3.6s at the moment.
2019-05-12T13:38:15Z: At present though, a pitstop for Vettel is going to drop him into a load of cars queuing up over the final points position. They're all on soft tyres too so will pit soon but he's not exactly going to have clear air.
2019-05-12T13:35:26Z: Verstappen and Leclerc in third and fourth are on a basically identical pace, both solidly doing 1m22.8s. That's a second off the Mercedes up front, and half a second quicker than the struggling Vettel.
2019-05-12T13:34:43Z: Hamilton isn't a lot faster than Bottas, but he's doing just enough - another fastest lap, a 1m21.766s, takes him nearly four seconds clear after 15 laps.
2019-05-12T13:33:11Z: Ricciardo's pursuit of Sainz is the closest on track at the moment, but the Renault man still can't find a way through. This is also giving Albon a bit of breathing space in 10th.
2019-05-12T13:32:32Z: Leclerc is quickly leaving Vettel behind, but he's not actually making any inroads on the gap to Verstappen in third.
2019-05-12T13:31:26Z: Fastest lap from Hamilton again, although his 1m21.947s is only 0.06s quicker than Bottas on the same lap.
2019-05-12T13:30:48Z: Lead gaps lap 12: 1 Hamilton; 2 Bottas +3.4s; 3 Verstappen +7.4s; 4 Leclerc +11.9s; 5 Vettel +14.0s; 6 Gasly +17.1s
2019-05-12T13:30:26Z: Leclerc immediately set the best first sector of anyone so far after that, and is now trying to close down the 4.5s gap to Verstappen in third.
2019-05-12T13:30:01Z: That was pretty clear from Vettel, he pulled to the inside approaching Turn 1 and backed right off.
2019-05-12T13:29:35Z: And Leclerc is through - looks like Ferrari asked Vettel to make the switch.
2019-05-12T13:28:42Z: Hulkenberg has passed Norris for 15th, and Russell is also ahead of Kubica now.
2019-05-12T13:27:21Z: Leclerc takes another look at Vettel approaching Turn 1, getting a bit closer than his previous attempt. But still no way past the sister Ferrari.
2019-05-12T13:26:45Z: Vettel is a second off the Mercedes' pace and has already admitted he is struggling with a flatspotted tyre. Leclerc is right behind him and they're now 3s behind third-placed Verstappen.
2019-05-12T13:26:44Z: At the head of the midfield order, Grosjean has 3.8s in hand over team-mate Magnussen - looks like Haas has no cause for fear just yet. Kyvat is around a second further back.
2019-05-12T13:26:07Z: Hamilton cements his fastest lap point a little tighter with a 1m21.972s, pulling his lead out to nearly three seconds on lap nine.
2019-05-12T13:24:49Z: Leclerc gets extremely close to Vettel going into Turn 1 and has a little look down the inside. It wasn't a serious, serious passing attempt but he's letting his team-mate know his intentions.
2019-05-12T13:23:40Z: Giovinazzi is the first driver to pit and rejoins on the hard tyre.
2019-05-12T13:23:38Z: Another fastest lap for Hamilton, a 1m22.254s.
2019-05-12T13:23:16Z: Ricciardo gets a nice DRS-assisted tow from Sainz down the main straight, but doesn't commit to an overtake after feigning a move into the braking zone.
2019-05-12T13:22:55Z: Verstappen in third is now 4.5s off the lead, and 2.5s clear of the two Ferraris - which are getting increasingly close.
2019-05-12T13:22:32Z: Fastest lap goes back to Hamilton, a 1m22.310s puts his lead up to 2.4s on lap six.
2019-05-12T13:21:13Z: The closest part of the lead gap is the Ferrari versus Ferrari fight for fourth, with Leclerc only just out of DRS range behind Vettel.
2019-05-12T13:20:51Z: Bottas sets fastest lap again, a 1m22.676s. But Hamilton has edged the lead gap up to 2s again now.
2019-05-12T13:20:40Z: Another replay shows Raikkonen, who is now up to 18th past Williams pair Kubica and Russell, going deep at Turn 4 and running into the gravel.
2019-05-12T13:20:00Z: Replays show it got extremely close between the two Mercedes at the first corner as both tried to look after their own interests while not taking each other out. Bottas was properly pincered between Hamilton and Vettel.
2019-05-12T13:17:59Z: Early gaps: 1 Hamilton; 2 Bottas +1.8s; 3 Verstappen +3.0s; 4 Vettel +4.5s; 5 Leclerc +5.8s; 6 Gasly +7.1s
2019-05-12T13:17:18Z: Bottas is three tenths faster than Hamilton in sector two, too.
2019-05-12T13:16:54Z: Bottas isn't settling into a dutiful second - he's just done the fastest lap of anyone so far on lap two, and takes another two tenths out of Hamilton in sector one as they begin lap three.
2019-05-12T13:15:48Z: Hamilton is two seconds ahead of Bottas as they cross the line for the first time, then it's Verstappen, Vettel, Leclerc and Gasly.
2019-05-12T13:15:22Z: That commotion allowed Grosjean to have a look at Leclerc and Gasly, but he's now dropped into seventh and the lead of the midfield ahead of Magnussen, Kvyat and Albon.
2019-05-12T13:15:12Z: Pierre Gasly had to battle hard to fend off Romain Grosjean but he succeeded and hangs onto sixth.
2019-05-12T13:14:57Z: Vettel went wide as he locked up, nearly lost out to Charles Leclerc, and Max Verstappen managed to get around both Ferraris as they slowed each other.
2019-05-12T13:14:28Z: Hamilton makes it through the first complex first, Vettel locks up and Bottas hangs on to second.
2019-05-12T13:14:13Z: Lights out, and Lewis Hamilton makes the best getaway of the front pack and Sebastian Vettel attacks down the outside too.
2019-05-12T13:11:23Z: The field is off on the formation lap smoothly.
2019-05-12T13:05:42Z:
It’s bad news for Hulkenberg. He will take the race start from the pitlane after Renault decided to swap the specification of his front wing during qualifying after a Q1 shunt.
Nico Hulkenberg will start the Spanish Grand Prix from the pitlane after Renault broke Formula 1 parc ferme rules by changing the specification of his front wing during qualifying
2019-05-12T13:03:08Z: A quick reminder of the grid. After a storming lap in qualifying, Bottas scored pole by some six tenths over team-mate Hamilton. Vettel starts third ahead of Verstappen and Leclerc.
2019-05-12T12:56:47Z: But that’s an issue for a later date. The more pressing concerns are: can Mercedes maintain its 100% record of 1-2 finishes in 2019, or can Ferrari close the gap?
2019-05-12T12:56:17Z: Good afternoon. A warm welcome to Autosport’s live coverage of the Spanish Grand Prix from Barcelona – a venue that the circuit bosses are vying to keep on the calendar for 2020.
